ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:

I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My speaking, writing, and grammar skills improved dramatically over such a short period of time. More importantly, though, my understanding and introduction to the culture of different Spanish-speaking countries and peoples were extraordinary, we were introduced to so many different media such as paintings, films, poetry, and so much more that really expanded my understanding of the language through the culture.
My ability to comprehend spoken Spanish and speak fluidly increased greatly over the course of the semester.
I learned a lot about Spanish culture as well as grammar and vocabulary.

I definitely furthered my understanding of the spanish language and world during this course. We learned the more advanced grammer rules and consumed online spanish media in the form of podcasts, movies, and news articles.

In this Spanish 140 section taught by Professor Karina Lopez, the course not only expanded my knowledge of the Spanish language, but also enriched my learning of different Spanish-speaking cultures, including bits of their music, art, and history. To teach us more than just the foreign language, Professor Lopez engaged each of the students by using interesting methods and mediums (e.g., podcasts, movies, art, cultural research projects, etc. and not just the daily textbook spelling and grammar. She also honed our abilities to listen, speak, and write in Spanish.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I found the instruction in this course excellent and enjoyed the community of it as well.

A strength was definitely Professor Lopez and her energy, as well as the collaborative spirit of the class. Talking to everyone in the class made it much more interesting and Im glad to have improved my Spanish through a lot of practice situations and talking exercises. A weakness would be the lack of help before tests and not really getting a full idea of what tests will be like.

I think bi-weekly spanish lunch tables within the class could be a great option to help us develop our spanish speaking skills. One thing that lacked this semester was that inperson talking aspect and a lunch every other week that is encouraged by allowing that as a skip for doing homework that day could be a great option to practice our speaking.

The top strength of this section of SPAN 140 is the Professor, Karina Lopez! Each week, she chose fascinating resource materials and mediums to teach Spanish language as well as bits of culture of different Spanish-speaking cultures. Using parts of podcasts, music, artwork, short stories, and history (in class discussions and homework assignments) provided important and interesting context for daily homework and learning of the language. Professor Lopez's caring manner and style also made it easier to talk and engage in class!
...Also, a super minor thing: it could be a tiny bit more clear which document is meant to be completed if multiple documents have similar file names in the Canvas page for this SPAN 140 section. :)

...One weakness (not related to Professor Lopez's section!) would be the length/difficulty of the "Semana __ Tarea __" homework assignments which are assigned by the SPAN 140 Umbrella/overall course page on Canvas.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The small group discussions facilitated through the breakout room feature on Zoom were really helpful in maximizing our Spanish-speaking skills in class. Additionally, the group writing sessions each day were also helpful in improving writing skills. I think, in this case, the virtual format actually benefitted us greatly because we received edits and suggestions on our writing in real-time, and within the first month of the course, I was writing more dramatically correct and efficiently than I ever have in Spanish. The course was very well adapted to the online format, more so than most of my other courses.
A success was the use of breakout rooms to meet everyone in the class. There are no improvements that I can think of.
The materials chosen made learning accessible in a virtual learning environment.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! Very good stepping stone to the Spanish culture and learning more about all aspects of the Spanish language. Whether you are taking it just for the credit or not, you will enjoy it!

Yes, I'd recommend taking SPAN 140  ...and if you're taking SPAN 140, I'd definitely recommend Professor Karina Lopez!
The top strength of this section of SPAN 140 is the Professor, Karina Lopez! Each week, she chose fascinating resource materials and mediums to teach Spanish language as well as bits of culture of different Spanish-speaking cultures. Using parts of podcasts, music, artwork, short stories, and history (in class discussions and homework assignments) provided important and interesting context for daily homework and learning of the language. Professor Lopez's caring manner and style also made it easier to talk and engage in class!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: In person seminar style classes with office hours
